Class Particle

A basic particle. For particles that provide UI, you may like to instead use DOMParticle.

Hierarchy

  • Particle
    • DomParticleBase

matches

  • matches(particle: Particle): boolean
    • Defined in runtime/recipe/particle.ts:126

    Param particle matches this particle if the names are the same and the slot and handle requirements this particle is a subset of the slot and handle requirements of the param particle.

    Parameters

    • particle: Particle

    Returns boolean

onHandleDesync

  • onHandleDesync(handle: Handle): void
    • Defined in runtime/particle.ts:104

    Called for handles that are configured with both keepSynced and notifyDesync, when they are detected as being out-of-date against the backing store. For Variables, the event that triggers this will also resync the data and thus this call may usually be ignored. For Collections, the underlying proxy will automatically request a full copy of the stored data to resynchronize. onHandleSync will be invoked when that is received.

    Parameters

    • handle: Handle

      The Handle instance that was desynchronized.

    Returns void

onHandleSync

  • onHandleSync(handle: Handle, model: any): void
    • Defined in runtime/particle.ts:76

    Called for handles that are configured with both keepSynced and notifySync, when they are updated with the full model of their data. This will occur once after setHandles() and any time thereafter if the handle is resynchronized.

    Parameters

    • handle: Handle

      The Handle instance that was updated.

    • model: any

      For Variable-backed Handles, the Entity data or null if the Variable is not set. For Collection-backed Handles, the Array of Entities, which may be empty.

    Returns void

onHandleUpdate

  • onHandleUpdate(handle: Handle, update: object): void
    • Defined in runtime/particle.ts:92

    Called for handles that are configued with notifyUpdate, when change events are received from the backing store. For handles also configured with keepSynced these events will be correctly ordered, with some potential skips if a desync occurs. For handles not configured with keepSynced, all change events will be passed through as they are received.

    Parameters

    • handle: Handle

      The Handle instance that was updated.

    • update: object

      An object containing one of the following fields:

      • data: The full Entity for a Variable-backed Handle.
      • added: An Array of Entities added to a Collection-backed Handle.
      • removed: An Array of Entities removed from a Collection-backed Handle.
      • Optional added?: any
      • Optional data?: any
      • Optional originator?: any
      • Optional removed?: any

    Returns void

setHandles

  • setHandles(handles: Map<string, Handle>): void
    • Defined in runtime/particle.ts:58

    This method is invoked with a handle for each store this particle is registered to interact with, once those handles are ready for interaction. Override the method to register for events from the handles.

    Parameters

    • handles: Map<string, Handle>

      a map from handle names to store handles.

    Returns void
